data.title: Phillip Barger
data.meta_description: Phillip Barger passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the Clinton Herald on 2020-12-07.
data.text:
Phillip Grantham Barger, a longtime resident of Clinton, passed away on December 3rd.

Born in 1939 in Manhattan, Kansas, the son of Edgar Barger, Professor of Agriculture at Kansas State University and Carolyn (Grantham) Barger. Phil lived throughout the Midwest, spending time in Iowa, Michigan, and Wisconsin as a young boy. An All-American football player at William Horlick high school in Racine, Wisconsin. He attended the University of Michigan and Kansas State University, where he played quarterback. At K-State he received degrees in Agricultural Engineering and Business Administration, was a member of the Phi Delta Theta fraternity and served in the ROTC. He had a blind date with a red headed Kappa Kappa Gamma girl named Sara (Rusty) Crum. They were married 6 months after their first date in her hometown of Eureka, Kansas.

He served two years in the Army based in Germany. He then started his first career as a sales manager with Cummins Diesel Engines and then Director of Export Sales with Massey Ferguson and Perkins Engines. They had operations in England, Canada and the U.S. and he served at all of them. He traveled to dozens of countries. Along the way, he and Sara had three children, Christy, David, and Tory.

In 1990, Phil and Sara bought Gateway Marble Products in Fulton, Illinois. They operated the company until 2009. Phil was a caring and loving husband to his beautiful wife Sara of 54 years. Any spare moment he had would be spent playing golf, bridge and following his beloved K-State Wildcats. He was president of the Clinton Area Showboat Theater, Clinton Rotary Club, Clinton Builders Club, and served on the boards of the Red Cross, United Way, Sharer Foundation, Clinton Humane Society, and the 1st Methodist Church of Clinton.

He is survived by his children Christina Klug and her husband Tom O'Brien, David Barger and his wife Christina Carbo, Tory Parsons and her husband Brian Parsons. He has five grandchildren, Sam Klug, David Klug, Mitchell Parsons, Reid Parsons and Remy Howden. Also, his brother James Barger and brother-in- law/sister-in-law David and Betty Crum.

No funeral services have been arranged. Memorials may be made in his honor to the 1st United Methodist Church of Clinton, or the Clinton Humane Society.
